image.altText: A man with a long beard wears a suit, sunglasses and an Islamic cap as he walks into a court building, surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: An influential former Islamic State supporter who was released from a supervision order last year was questioned in yesterday's police raids on an alleged terrorism network involving a group of Sydney boys.

title.children: Influential alleged former IS member Wassim Fayad raided in Sydney counter-terror blitz

image.altText: Rosie Batty

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Rosie Batty has reiterated calls for stronger language in cases of violence against women.

title.children: Rosie Batty says bail law changes won't keep victim-survivors safe

image.altText: Crowd of people walking

props.synopsis: Anzac Day is commemorated across Australia and New Zealand, from dawn services and marches to games of two-up, on the 109th anniversary of the Gallipoli landings.

title.children: Dawn services, parades and two-up: Australians commemorate Anzac Day across the nation and beyond

image.altText: man in suit rubbing hands together next to logo of a white x on black background

props.synopsis: In a worst-case scenario for Elon Musk, could Australia ban his platform if he refuses to take down all videos of the Wakeley church stabbing?

title.children: Could X be banned from your phone? The worst-case scenario for Elon Musk

image.altText: A woman in military uniform in front of desert landscape.

props.synopsis: Space is the frontier for Major General Susan Coyle, the soon-to-be highest-ranking woman in Australia's military, whose future is bright as she oversees new areas of conflict.

title.children: Meet Australia's first female leader of a 'warfighting domain'

image.altText: Two men in matching outfits walk closely together along a dirt track, jungle visible on either side.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's two-day hike along the Kokoda Track with his PNG counterpart was an opportunity to forge closer ties with Australia's closest neighbour — and send a message to his predecessor, too.

title.children: Albanese's PNG trip comes with it a subtle jab at Morrison. King's was about as subtle as a sledgehammer

image.altText: A line of beached whales stretches up a beach with people in the shallow water.

props.synopsis: More than 20 whales are dead after 160 became beached during a mass stranding event in WA's south-west.

title.children: More than 20 whales dead, 100 others move offshore in WA's south in mass stranding event

image.altText: TikTok Block?

props.synopsis: A ban on TikTok is now almost inevitable in the US as President Joe Biden signs legislation banning the app unless the Chinese-based parent company ByteDance sells the app to an approved buyer.  Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Joe Biden has signed the bill banning TikTok in the US over security concerns. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A woman standing outside on a footpath, smiling.

props.synopsis: 2.9 million people with HECS-HELP debt will be hit by an increase of 4.7 per cent when their debts are indexed on June 1st, but there are calls for massive change.

title.children: Universities review chief calls for HECS debt 'gremlins' to be cleaned out

image.altText: A pile of bright coloured ants pile together to create a raft on water. the photo is so close you can see a reflection

props.synopsis: An outbreak of invasive fire ants in one of the largest catchments of the Murray-Darling Basin has experts worried four states could be affected if the pest spreads.

title.children: Four states in firing line as more invasive fire ants nests found on army base

image.altText: An older man wearing his decorated military uniform aboard a destroyer ship

props.synopsis: Brian Hopkins was one of the last people to escape after two Australian naval ships collided. Living with terminal cancer, he revisits his former life and considers his legacy.

title.children: This veteran was in the shower when his navy warship collided with an aircraft carrier. He considers his legacy

image.altText: Two police officers in tactical gear stand on a street with their backs to the camera

props.synopsis: Police have told a court two of the five teenagers arrested after counterterrorism raids were carried out across Sydney had videos of beheadings on their phones that were produced by the Islamic State.

title.children: Police allege two teenagers charged after counterterrorism raids in Sydney had videos of beheadings on phones

image.altText: The view through a plane window of people bogged on an outback road.

props.synopsis: Police rescue travellers from a flood-stricken area in WA's Goldfields after they had become stranded, and return them to  the remote community of Tjuntjuntjara.

title.children: Eight travellers rescued after being found stranded in outback WA

image.altText: A 106-year-old man sits on a floral couch and looks at the camera. Photo albums are open on the coffee table in front.

props.synopsis: World War II veteran Colin Wagener joined the military with three friends in 1938. He returned to Australia in 1945 after serving in Borneo, but has never joined an Anzac Day march.

title.children: 'It's not my thing': 106-year-old war veteran opts out of Anzac Day marches

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police commissioner Reece Kershaw told the National Press Club today police were reviewing the matter to see whether an investigation was needed into how an image of Brittany Higgins's text messages came to be in the possession of the Seven Network.

title.children: Police reviewing how image of Brittany Higgins's texts was obtained by Seven ahead of Bruce Lehrmann interview

image.altText: Two women in coats

props.synopsis: After decades of forcing Chinese couples to limit themselves to just one child, Beijing has now reversed course and is urging people to have more babies. The trouble is, many young people aren't interested.

title.children: Xi is urging Chinese women to get pregnant for the good of the country. Here's why many are ignoring him

image.altText: Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: There is a crisis in Australia and women don't feel safe. The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence commissioner wants that to change.

title.children: Violence against women is in the spotlight again. But this time, is the conversation shifting?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and PNG Prime Minister James Marape  lay at wreath at an ANZAC service.

props.synopsis: The prime minister tells the crowd at an Anzac Day dawn service in Papua New Guinea that Australia "will never forget" the help the country's people provided to Australian soldiers during World War II.

title.children: 'We will never forget' people of PNG: Albanese speaks at dawn service at Isurava

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with no hair and wearing glasses stands beside a mannequin wearing a red dress from the film The Dressmaker.

props.synopsis: A recent ABC News feature about how to share news of cancer diagnoses prompted some of our readers to share their own experiences. These are their words.

title.children: Readers share how they dealt with their cancer diagnoses

image.altText: The fence at the Alexander Maconochie Centre.

props.synopsis: The court heard the woman's victim, who was a Narcotics Anonymous volunteer visiting the jail, was left with bad scars on her chest after the attack in 2022.

title.children: Canberra prisoner who poured boiling tea on volunteer sentenced to further jail time

image.altText: A grass strip next to a road with multiple bouquets of flowers and a wooden cross.

props.synopsis: The mother of a teenager who died in a car crash in Canberra says she wasn't told her son had been missing for three days before the crash which claimed his life.

title.children: Mother of Indigenous 15-year-old who died in car crash while in state care says the system failed him

image.altText: The Moulin Rouge sign missing some letters with the windmill sails missing.

props.synopsis: The iconic Moulin Rouge windmill in Paris is missing its sails, which fell to the ground overnight.

title.children: Sails of iconic Paris cabaret club Moulin Rouge fall overnight

image.altText: Man in doorway

props.synopsis: A man who repeatedly raped a young girl after breaking into her home in an ordeal lasting hours is released into the community because he is unfit to plead to the charges against him.

title.children: Man who repeatedly raped young girl released into community as judge rules him unfit to plead to charges

image.altText: Two frames, one of a mushroom cloud, the other an old man with medals.

props.synopsis: Sam Darke said he and other servicemen were "shocked" when they bore witness to Britain's nuclear bomb test at South Australia's Emu Field, feeling treated like "guinea pigs" who wore no protection and were simply told to cover their eyes.

title.children: Australian servicemen like Sam were 'guinea pigs' for nuclear bomb test that caused 'untold damage'

image.altText: A posthumous portrait of Lieutenant Michael McCaughey

props.synopsis: In the last days of 1943 a brave young Australian soldier, whose family played an influential role developing Australia's irrigation industries, lost his life trying to save wounded comrades in the mountains of Papua New Guinea.

title.children: Eight decades after their death, two Australian soldiers are helping advance an unlikely industry

image.altText: A pink background with a red laptop and yellow emoticon faces flying around the edges of the screen

props.synopsis: Algorithmic feeds should personalise our online experiences, but instead they are "deadening our tastes" and fostering a dull conformity.

title.children: The insidious nature of algorithmic feeds and how they're flattening our culture

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: While Anthony Albanese says we're in a "race for jobs" with other countries offering big government subsidies and can't afford to be "left behind", Productivity Commissioner Danielle Wood isn't sure it's a race we should even be in.

title.children: The government wants a future 'made in Australia'. The productivity commissioner isn't convinced

image.altText: Pedestrians cross Flinders Street near Swanston Street in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: The ABS has scrapped plans to collect information about ethnicity in the 2026 census, and some experts say it is missing a huge opportunity.

title.children: The ABS has changed its mind about ethnicity in the next census. Here's what the experts say

image.altText: A Solomon Islander in a red shirt dropping a vote in a box

props.synopsis: An intense period of political horse-trading is underway in Solomon Islands after no political party won enough seats in last week's election to form government on its own.

title.children: 'All sorts of corruption': Solomon Islands MPs head to hotels to pick the PM in 'extraordinary' process

image.altText: Vietnamese soldier in uniform of the left with John Bryant on teh right. They are standing in the jungle in front of trees.

props.synopsis: John Bryant has dedicated his life and life savings to uncovering the bodies of missing Vietnamese soldiers he and his battalion killed in combat.

title.children: Five decades after fighting in Vietnam, John Bryant has returned to help find the bodies he buried

image.altText: Four men from three generations of the Copeman family in photos.

props.synopsis: The Copeman family's commitment to the country spans generations from WWI to Vietnam. Now their legacy will live on in a memorial garden south-west of Sydney.

title.children: Three generations of sacrifice: The Copeman family's legacy of love and military service

image.altText: Shot from the plane's interior, a large case of supplies is airdropped down to Antarctica.

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry has heard the Department of Defence has been enlisted to potentially deliver supplies, including much-needed coffee, to Mawson Station after an earlier resupply voyage was disrupted when cranes malfunctioned on Australia's $528 million icebreaker.

title.children: Defence may have to airdrop coffee, other supplies, to Antarctic expeditioners after Nuyina's failure

image.altText: A police car sits parked out the front of an address where a woman was found deceased.

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old man faces numerous charges following the death of a 49-year-old woman in Cobram, in Victoria's north this week. Police believe the pair were known to each other.

title.children: Man charged over the death of woman in Cobram, in Victoria's north

image.altText: Rat shaped hole in side walked with a puddle in it and coins scattered all around

props.synopsis: The imprint has been a quirk of a residential block in Chicago’s North Side for years, but it found fresh fame in January on social media platform X.

title.children: Chicago's 'rat hole' removed after city determines footpath was damaged

image.altText: A Top End barra taxed by a shark

props.synopsis: Global concern about shark sustainability is at odds with the experience of some WA anglers who are reporting more encounters with the animals. So for the first time data collected off the state's coast will confirm the numbers.

title.children: Fishers are reporting more encounters with sharks. So are numbers rising or declining?
